filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf

patient_sex_quote: From the Diagnostica e Interventistica Cardiovascolare, Ospedali Riuniti di Bergamo, Bergamo, Italy.
treatment_quote: The International Society of Heart and Lung Transplantation (ISHLT) Registry shows that approximately 20% of early deaths after heart transplantation is attributable to right heart failure. 1,2 Heterotopic heart transplantation (HHT), with anastomosis of the donor pulmonary artery to the recipient right atrium, is a potential solution to avoid this complication. This report updates our prior results with the use of this technique.
comorbidities: ['restrictive cardiomyopathy', 'idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy', 'ischemic cardiomyopathy', 'anthracycline chemotherapy', 'severe left ventricular dysfunction after resection of a sub-aortic membrane', 'corrected transposition of great arteries with right isomerism', 'ventricular septal defect']
filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf
extraction_notes: The text doesn't provide specific data for some fields such as presenting symptoms, imaging findings, histopathology, and immunohistochemistry.

diagnostic_method: ['High-resolution CT (HRCT)', 'routine contrast-enhanced chest CT', 'right upper lobectomy']
imaging_findings: ['A 2-cm nodule with inhomogeneous enhancement and an irregular border with fine spiculation surrounded by a zone of ground-glass opacity; tiny nodules of ground-glass attenuation (1-3 mm in diameter); multiple small nodules of ground-glass attenuation']
histopathology: ['Well-differentiated adenocarcinoma, papillary subtype; minute pulmonary meningotheliallike nodules (MPMNs) consisting of cellular proliferations of meningothelial-like cells']
immunohistochemistry: ['Meningothelial-like nodules were immunoreactive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and vimentin; other studies reported positive immunoreactivity for myosin and vimentin in all meningothelial-like nodules']
outcome: ['The primary tumor was successfully removed, followed by no change in the MPMNs for an additional 6-month period']
comorbidities: ['Associated with thromboembolism, cardiac disease, and malignancy']
